thread.title: George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director
thread.title_full: George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director

author: Shannon Green, Mike Bianchi
title: George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director
text:
George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director 
UCF Football coach George O'Leary announced Monday that he has stepped down as UCF interim athletics director. 
UCF Football coach George O'Leary announced Monday that he has stepped down as UCF interim athletics director. George O'Leary has stepped down as interim athletics director and the school is searching for a new AD 
George O'Leary has stepped down as UCF's interim athletics director, the school announced Monday 
The Orlando Sentinel reported the news, citing two sources with knowledge of the decision, earlier Monday. 
The news comes just a few days after the 0-6 Knights posted a 40-13 loss to UConn, one of the worst losses in school history at Bright House Networks Stadium before an announced crowd of 26,669 fans. That turnout was the lowest at a home game since Nov. 25, 2011, when UCF beat UTEP 31-14 in front of 21,127. 
O'Leary replaced Todd Stansbury, who left to lead Oregon State's athletic department this summer. UCF President John Hitt told the Orlando Sentinel last month O'Leary's term would run through December, and then the school would evaluate his performance and to see if the football coach still wanted to pursue the job full-time. 
UCF has hired a national search firm agency to fill the position. 
“I thank George for his service and dedication in this interim role,” UCF president John Hitt said in a news release. “Our national search will allow us to hire an outstanding leader who can build on the success we’ve achieved academically, competitively and in the community.” George O'Leary discusses his future as UCF coach 
George O'Leary talks about his future as UCF's football coach. 
George O'Leary talks about his future as UCF's football coach. 
Grant Heston, UCF vice president for communications and marketing, will oversee the search and athletics department operations for the university. 
Brad Stricklin, executive senior associate athletics director, will serve as interim athletics director. 
O'Leary became the first acting head coach to juggle athletic director duties at UCF since Gene McDowell and was among a small fraternity of football coaches who have taken on the daunting challenge, including Barry Alvarez at Wisconsin and Tom Osborne at Nebraska. 
Before the season, O'Leary said he wasn't overwhelmed by the responsibility. He said he split his time between to offices putting in a few hours in the afternoon for his administrative duties. He's praised senior administrator Brad Stricklin in the past as one of the key individuals who helped keep him organized. Orlando News Now: George O'Leary steps down as UCF interim athletics director 
George O'Leary is expected to announce that he will step down as UCF's interim athletics director during his weekly press conference today, two sources told the Orlando Sentinel. 
George O'Leary is expected to announce that he will step down as UCF's interim athletics director during his weekly press conference today, two sources told the Orlando Sentinel. 
O'Leary will turn his attention toward helping to get UCF ready for a difficult four-game American Athletic Conference stretch, starting with a road game against undefeated Temple Saturday. 
CBS Sports Network will air the game at 7:30 p.m. 
E-mail Shannon Green at sgreen@orlandosentinel.com. Follow her on Twitter at @osknights.
